description: Extremely hot and cold places should be difficult to traverse and live in. /6/Comprehensive/6/ uses a very lightweight heat and cold system based on the biome you are in.
You will see /6/your hearts change/6/ in Cold and Hot biomes; /4/fire symbols mean you're heating up/4/, and /b/icy symbols mean you're freezing/b/.
When your /6/heat/cold bar fills up/6/, you may experience effects, like blurred vision, hunger, weakness, and eventually, /4/injury and death/4/.
Thankfully, there are easy ways to counteract these effects.

/b/In Cold biomes/b/, like Frozen Oceans, Tundras, and Taigas, try hanging out near a Campfire or inside a building, finding and walking near certain types of warm, orange Lichen, or crafting Fur armor to stave off the biting cold.

/4/In Hot biomes/4/, like Deserts, Mesas, and Dunes, try hanging out in water pools or under shaded areas, drinking or eating specific foods, or crafting a Waterskin and a Sun Hat so you don't dry out.

__/4/Note that the Nether is an extremely hot and hostile area, make sure to prepare carefully. /4/__ There are certain plant types in the Nether that may be useful when traversing the scorchy depths.
Try searching REI for "/b/@Frostiful/b/" and "/4/@Scorchful/4/" for other useful items to explore the most hostile biomes in /6/Comprehensive/6/.
If you choose to live in these inhospitable areas, make sure you do your research first.
